instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wifi: No hardware installed [solved]
threads.message: Hey Louis, I decided to join the forum, even though I have watched all of your videos and attended your tutoring! I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that is showing the wifi symbol crossed out and stating no hardware is installed.  In my little experience, I have never encounter this problem that was not software related.  Anyone have any ideas on where I should start??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wifi: No hardware installed [solved]
threads.message: Have you tried with a different Wifi card, these go bad from time to time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wifi: No hardware installed [solved]
threads.message:
First thing, try known good wifi card/cable.

Second thing, what voltage do you get on each side of L3404?

A "hint" that the wifi card is dead is when it pulls down <SIGNAL>AP_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL> when all signals are present to create <SIGNAL>AP_RESET_CONN_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wifi: No hardware installed [solved]
threads.message: Wifi card replaced, and it works. Thanks for the help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Wifi: No hardware installed [solved]
threads.message: Glad you solved it, now make like hot potato and dump this on somebody else before GPU dies!
